name: Men of War™
description: Men of War is a stunning Real-Time Strategy game that takes place during the height of World War II. Intense battles span Europe and North Africa as gamers play as Soviet, Allied or German forces across 19 massive single-player missions.

reviews.review_text: Hmm... how should I put this? Imagine Arma, okay? Imagine all of the realism, immersion, tension that has Arma featured. Now, since Arma set in modern world, how about change them into WW2. Nice, isn't it? Alright, now change the FPS camera into isometric top down that can zoom in into your unit's scale.  Now you get Men of War. 10/10

This is just the best strategy game I have ever played, maybe even the best game i have ever played.  For those of you who dont know men of war is a real time strategy game where you can take direct controll over one of your units and play as him (works like a twin stick shooter). The whole series is just genious it has fun missions epic battles and even a little element of story. The missions are like a pazzle and you are basicly free to do the mission how ever you like for exemple: if you need to infiltrate a base you could try tom look for a hole on the fance,you could make a hole yourslef using an AT grenade,you could wait for enemy patrol try to steal theyr tank, you could try to snipe everyone in the base from far away or just try to just walk in from the main door.  this review applies not only on the original men of war but on all the series.  if you havent played it yet u should, no u MUST try it!
If u like RTS games this game is for you, it does not mess around, You have to be tactical and it has its own Unique play style,The difficulty is pretty badass nothing too easy like Company of Heros.
If you played this Men Of war, then you should buy every Men of War  9.9/10 No game is perfect
German soldier destroying Sherman screaming 'FOR UNCLE SAM'   Best voice acting 10/10

Excellent WWII simulator, with unparalled strategic combat. You can command a single soldier, and loot the battlefield, or platoons and parade them into the storm. Create the ultimate defenses by creating walls of sandbags and camoflauging artillery along roads. If you enjoy historic, strategy, WWII or just destroying your friends in game, then pick up a copy of this game, I got it on sale, but it's indefinately worth 10.00$. Because servers are down, directly connecting to friends is the only way to play multiplayer, but even if your friends don't own a copy I'm always up to play. Come; fight with or against me.
A hardcore game which dosn't hold the players hands, it tells you how to play and then throws you out in the jungle with a happy face, I love this game. Good editor and amazing gameplay. 9,5/10

This is still the best Men of War game made. The graphics may not be the best, and the voice acting is ♥♥♥♥ (hilariously), but this still trumps the other games by far. The only other game that is comparable is Faces of War, which was the game that came before MoW. MoW: Red Tide at least tried to stay close to it's roots, but suffered massively from the huge difficulty spike (compared to the original MoW) and the lack of any sort of Multiplayer (I mainly play single player games, but MoW was my exception). MoW: AS and MoW: AS2 completely changed the way the games were played previously. Changing it to more of a 'capture the flag' type game mode. Gone were the interesting characters, story, and missions. Instead you just get to play a bunch of scenario type maps that continually open up as you capture more 'flags'. That is not the MoW I enjoyed. Lastly, 1C decided to milk the series with a bunch of terrible spin-offs that I hope no one ever has to experience. The two most prominent ones being MoW: Vietnam (♥♥♥♥ing terrible game), and MoW: Condemned Heroes (which I never played, but have seen playthroughs of...it is terrible as well). They have also started to use the engine to allow a bunch of indie/small developers to make some MoW-lite games based in other periods (such as WW1, Civil War, and Modern times). None of these, however, have been able to stack up to the original Men of War. I don't understand why 1C decided to waste the success of Men of War on all these stupid spin-offs. They could have made a Men of War 2, just using the Modern engine, and with the same kind of experience MoW 1 had. But no, they'll just keep wasting the potential that Men of War had on these stupid games that are completely different from what Men of War originally was.  Overall, I'd give this game a solid 8.5/10. It isn't perfect, and has many issues, but it is still the best game that the 'series' has come up with. It's just a shame that this will never see a proper sequel that will live up to it's name-sake.
hard as ♥♥♥♥
i realy loved the game 10/10

Men of War is one of the gaming industry's biggest accomplishments, settling once of for all the debate of whether games can be considered to be art. Men of War is one of gaming's first autobiographical games which follows the heavy metal band Manowar from their inception during the 1980s. The game has a beautiful opening scene wherein the player controls bassist Joey DeMaio while he snorts the biggest line of cocaine in his life while backstage at a Black Sabbath concert, and neglects to fulfill his duties as a sober fireworks manager. In this sequence the player must complete a series of quick-time-events in order to guide a stumbling Demaio into correctly setting off the fireworks in order to not burn the stage down. During this sequence the quick-time-events get harder to the point where the player cannot complete them, which reveals that Ross the Boss is right beside you and like a true bro, covers over for DeMaio and succeeds in not causing the death of Ronnie James Dio. DeMaio and Ross the Boss become best bros at that moment and start legendary metal band Manowar.  The rest of the game is a re-tooled version of Activision's Guitar Hero, but all of the songs are from Manowar.
The most detailed and most tactical RTS game I ever played. Forget Company of Heroes. This is much better!
This is one of if not the best RTS games out there. I definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a bit of a challenge.
Awesome game, very realistic and exciting.

Brilliant game, an RTS with real character and depth.  The first allied mission is ♥♥♥♥ though

This game has an awesome game engine with great graphics. I do recommend getting it, but players tend to feel how hard and challenging levels can actually be. The multiplayer server shut down, but there are ways around that...

Men of War is the almost-classic installment in the Men of War series, Faces of War being the second and Soldiers: Heroes of World War 2 being the first. This is the first title with 'Men of War'. It has more modern graphics than its predecessors and has quite the long amount of missions. It also has bonus missions.  Pros: - Realistic warfare simulator. Strategy matters and every little detail counts.  - Has a long campaign with bonus missions.  - Has nice graphics for its time.  - Only game that has this level of creativity, detail, difficulty, realism and fun in a RTS.  - Has an editor so you can make your own battles and mess around.  - Lists of other cool things!  Cons: - The micromanagement can get a little annoying.  - The HUD is a mess.  - Small AI bugs or random things(which are usually funny).  - Well... thats about it.  I have to recommend this game. If you have the money, consider the other story titles(Condemned Heroes, Red Tide, Vietnam) or the multiplayer based with SP skirmish missions titles Assualt Squad and Assualt Squad 2. That said, its worth trying out the earlier titles. There is mods that bring the Faces of War campaign and the Red Tide campaign to MOW AS2.

Do you like company of heroes, but feel like there is something missing, some actual depth or real strategy on the gameplay? Are you tired of seeing HP bars on tanks, making the game feel more like street fighter rather than a WW2 strategy game? Are you ready to take your micro skills to exhaustion while the game forces you to micro every single soldier to their tiny little inventory while controlling a massive platoon?  No? Well I don't give a damn anyway.

Plays Men of War with friend Plays as Germany and makes defences Fills the trenches with machine guns, artillery and S.S Troops My friend sends a scout force composed of 2 squads of infantry and 10 tanks, my defences kill them like it was nothing....I've held my position for 50 mins, just 10 more mins until the match was over....since I was winning and there was 10 mins remaining...I got cocky...I've stopped caring about reinforcments so my units were in short of ammunition. Next thing I know he bombards me with 10 rocket artillery....then sends in 10 IS-3's (Most OP Tank in the game) and distracts my tanks...then sends in 600 infantry men and took over my defences in under 5 mins... 10/10 would be rekt again and smash my keyboard in half. But overall this game is one of the best games I have had ever played.

While most of the 'good games' come from big fancy American, Canadian and British companies, Games that come from places like Russia, Poland and Ukraine are generally looked down upon. Men of War is one of those games from Eastern Europe. And like Stalker and Metro 2033, this game is surprisingly good for being developed by a small Ukrainian based company.   This is a really strange RTS/RPGS/FPS Hybrid. It's mainly a stragety game but it involves RPG elements like inventory management and such, theres also some features in there to take control of individual untis like an action game.  The editor is fairly easy to use and the battles are extremley realistic, but fun at the same time. If you can get used to the controls and how everything works, I highly reccommend tihs game to pretty much anyone who enjoys any kind of combat game.

I picked this up expecting something like World in Conflict or Company of Heroes. Instead, I found a game that required so much micro management that just getting a group of men to walk across a field required at least three button commands and constant attention.   On some level, I can appreciate the attempt to model some of the complexity of real war - tanks have individual sections that can be damaged for different effects, all units have limited ammo for you to keep track of, enemies have angles of vision that you can exploit for flanking attacks, etc. But the control interface and the AI of your units is so poor that constant micromanagement is necessary to keep your troops from getting slaughtered.   The tank you get command of in the very first mission is a terribly powerful weapon, but mine got destroyed over and over because it wouldn't turn to attack targets I commanded it to hit. Pray tell, why do I need to individually command the vehicle to turn around, find an angle of fire, and shoot when other strategy games let you do all of that with one button press?

This is absolutely abysmal. No one has any reason to purchase this monstrosity. You can't move, shoot, or do anything. You have absolutely no control over anyone or anything. Just sit and watch all your helpless 'soldiers' run around and die with awful voice acting and unforgiving camera movement and angles. Just save your money and use it for something that at least has some effort put into it.
Controls felt very clumsy. Soldiers would often stand perfectly still while enemy soldiers wiped them out. If this didn't come in a bundle, i would be mad i wasted my money on it.

The game was fun for the first level, after that its difficulty went mad high and you couldnt train any units, I expected the game to start with a base and where you could train units give them guns and such like that, no you have 3 campaigns and a few bonus missions, there wasnt a skirmish mode or anything like that, I expected the controls to be easy to understand, I was god awefully wrong, double shift double num 0 what... no just do all the normal keys not all this double press crap. Since there are only 3 campaigns, I dont think it will be that long of a game, nor will it be an everlasting fun game. It was made in 2009 and it does have good aspects and good gameplay, but the game shouldnt be any where near 15 dollars since its that old and has very poor voice acting, it was literally hilarious I was laughing out loud because of how bad the voice acting was. So, to wrap this up, if you like Age of Empires or any other stradegy game on the planet, do not buy this game, you will be madly dissapointed. A waste just like War Z was.

(Although, sadly the voice acting isn't on par with most of today's games, but that's hardly game-breaking by any standards)

This game is a successor to Soldiers: HOWW2 and Faces of War, some brilliant games that rewarded detailed planning, fast reflexes and initiative. They were not made for casuals. And this is why casuals hated them. Too buggy, too hard, uncomprehensible etc etc. Do not hear their whinning if you do not like to just faceroll a stupid AI, but instead you prefer having a challenge. I remember loading same spot like 20 times trying different things so the AI does not steam roll me. Having 3-5 soldiers and having to clear whole bases, kill/capture/disable tanks, escape etc is not something offered by many games.   This is continued in Men Of War. From 2nd mission and on, you will have to face MANY enemies more than you. I checked the end game stats and saw that I was facing like 1000 enemies in defensive missions...and you have like 50 at most. Not to mention the tanks. AI has some nice ability to kill your tanks easier that you can kill its. Yeah this can be frustrating. So, just be more careful. And save often.   Even if you are a veteran of S:HOWW2, some missions can be tough. Although there is no tactics mode like in Faces of War, you can still die easily by some direct shots. I cannot say much about...replayability. Playing 1 mission for 4h +, makes you feel relieved when you finish it. One thing that I disagree with is that you cannot do as much as you could do in S: HOWW2 when in pause. Having to command MANY squads, resupply their ammo while the AI launches attack after attack is sometimes very demanding. When you have 3-5 soldiers it is easy...no time pressure etc. But the game and its objectives are still viable, and I have screens where I lost like 10 soldiers/0 tanks in defenses. On normal. So, if you plan carefully, think, reload and try different ways to win, you will make it.   Again...it is not for casuals. If you are one, you will cry. If you like tough challenges, then you will love this difficult ♥♥♥♥♥. Graphics are nice. Enough to make take screens of the environment. Voiceovers and sound I do not care. I am muting all games so I can listen to music. Storyline. Again, I do not care much. I just like killing stuff. From what I saw it was there just to exist. Who really cares...  Physics and realism. The stuff I like: explosions, bodies launch at every direction, bullets fear the brave, they disperse, and they change direction when they hit hard surfaces. Cannon shells...2 types: explosive, armor penetrating. Self explanatory. Now the spotting dot shows you the area of dispersion, the possibility to penetrate and ofc the distance. All this changes according to angle, vehicle armor, its speed, your speed, and other factors. It is the detail that makes the difference, and in this factor the game is a diamond.  8.8/10 just because I wanted better pause tool, voiceovers and storyline that are there just to exist and sometimes AI kills your tanks too easily to make it even competitive.
Men of War is one of the grandest games I ever played. The story is the best that comes with the game and its multiplayer is quite good.
definitely!!!!
Not really much of an improvement on the old 'Soldiers: Heroes of WWII' graphically, game play wise or story wise. Dodgy voice acting too.

a great game, well detailed and magnificent performance. however i would not suggest anyone new to this sort of game mode to try this game out as it is very complicated and you must think ahead and stay alert on the battlefield.
It's adequate
Probably one of the hardest games I've played, very challanging and I love it.

Best game series ever. See a building? Blow it up with a well placed artillery/tank shell. No? How about ramming your ♥♥♥♥ing tank into it, taking it down with any other person inside? What about shrapnels? Do you like shrapnels? I ♥♥♥♥ing love shrapnels. All explosions are not based on the laughable spherical 'blast radiuses' but on flying razors that can cut your men 7 ways to sunday. If one of your unlucky ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s happens to be having his head over the trench when an artillery shell hits his position or a grenade hits the top side, you better ♥♥♥♥ing hope he's wearing a helmet and ducking or else you're going to have to scoop that ♥♥♥♥ for a brain of his off the ground. Disabled an enemy tank? Oh my, well did you know that you can open its inventory, take out that machine gun and ammo, then blast the ♥♥♥♥ out of the enemy? What about the fact that you can repair it on the field and use it as your own? What about the fact that EACH tank and vehicle has REALISTIC armor, sloping armor (that actually worK), and vital spots (ammo storage, fuel storage, etc.)? You can blow off their ♥♥♥♥ing tracks, turrets, and barrels for crying out loud!   The vehicles do not operate on the basis of the Company of Heroes 'health bars' but on the basis of reality. Soldiers do no damage with their rifles. Tanks get damaged based on where they hit with parts breaking down, hulls being pierced, and hulls being blown to bits.  The game puts Company of Heroes to utter devastating shame. Get it.   I prefer the older ones (Men of War, Men of War: Red Tide, etc.) as ammo and infantry are scarce, you are forced to scavenge, repair, and loot dead bodies for cartridges, tank shells, fuel, and so on. Good micromanagement.
I don't usually play strategy games, but when I do.... I prefer MoW.
GET THIS GAME GENTLEMEN it puts the amazing in RTS.
If u like ww2 stratages play men of war the best of all ww2 games

Great RTS. Seriously, this game will make you ♥♥♥♥ Zhukov, it's so micro-intensive. Games like Company of Heroes, Starcraft 2, RUSE or Command & Conquer are all babby mode compared to this thing.  The game is actually an RTT (Real Time Tactics) at heart and completely removes the base-building component you'd find in a lot of contemporary strategy games.   This leaves you to completely focus on per unit resource management, like equipping each individual soldier with a gun (or even multiple guns), ammo, helmets, grenades, special equipment, and sometimes armour.   There's also a whole host of World War 2 vehicles that include: light vehicles, tanks, self-propelled guns, and weapon emplacements.   Be warned! Cinematic voice-acting is horrendous while unit voice-acting is pretty good.  Also. Coop. The coop is awesome.

I've played this for more than 500 hours. I enjoy it a lot as you get a lot of controll and realism packed in decent graphics and historical weapons and units. buy buy buy XD
